trans-unit.target: TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_SEQ_00<tab>The chocobokeep cannot seem to decide if you are who she thinks you are.

TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_SEQ_01<tab>After recognizing you as an accomplished jockey and trainer, a chocobokeep encourages you to consider arranging a covering for your veteran race chocobo. If all goes well, the offspring produced from the union would have the potential to become an even greater race chocobo─yet there is also risk involved, for you would need to retire an experienced chocobo first. Should you wish to learn more, speak with Katering at Moogle's Gift Mounts in the Central Shroud.

TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_SEQ_02<tab>While Katering states that she can make arrangements for a covering at any time, she reminds you that any newborn fledglings would need to undergo basic training prior to entering their first race. Thus acquainted with the process, you now stand at a crossroads: will you rely upon an established veteran chocobo, or will you seek greater glory through its offspring?
TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Katering at Bentbranch Meadows.

TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_AUPHREY_000_000<tab>Wait...it's <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var>, isn't it? You're quite the jockey, <var 08 E905 ((miss)) ((sir)) /var>─and quite the trainer as well, from all indications.
TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_AUPHREY_000_001<tab>If you don't mind me asking, have you given any thought to arranging a covering?
TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_AUPHREY_000_002<tab>Surely you know of what I speak─a union between two race chocobos for the purpose of producing fledglings of a higher pedigree.
TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_AUPHREY_000_003<tab>Simply put: if successful, these fledglings will have the potential to surpass their parents as race chocobos!
TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_AUPHREY_000_004<tab>That being said, as a matter of policy, only retired chocobos are permitted to engage in these unions...
TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_AUPHREY_000_005<tab>Aye, that's right. You must weigh the potential gains from a fledgling against the certain loss of a veteran bird.
TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_AUPHREY_000_006<tab>The Gold Saucer is well aware that this decision entails tremendous risk, hence is why they provide breeding chocobos to help alleviate the burden.

TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_AUPHREY_000_007<tab>In any case, if I have piqued your interest, pray speak with Katering of Moogle's Gift Mounts. She is responsible for making arrangements for race chocobo coverings.

TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_SYSTEM_000_010<tab>Upon retiring a race chocobo of rank 40 or higher, you will receive a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>retired chocobo registration form<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Two such forms are required for arranging a covering.

TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_SYSTEM_000_011<tab>If you do not have two suitable retired chocobos, you may use a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>covering permission form<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to requisition the services of breeding stock. However, please note that both sire and dam cannot be breeding stock.
TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_SYSTEM_000_012<tab>Covering permission forms can be purchased from the tack & feed trader at the race counter.

TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_AUPHREY_000_015<tab>'Twould be a shame if you let your race chocobo's talents go to waste, would it not? Why not have Katering arrange a covering so that a new generation can carry on your veteran's legacy?

TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_KATERING_000_020<tab>Hm? Coverings? Aye, if you've a mind for it, we can make arrangements. Do bear in mind that any offspring will need to undergo basic training before entering the races, though.
TEXT_SUBGSC106_00576_KATERING_000_021<tab>If an' when you decide to avail yourself of our services, just give the word. Or, if you have any questions, ask an' I'll be happy to answer.
